An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to launch further attacks against the system.Refer to CTX114893 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2300.title: Citrix Presentation Server unauthorized access
CVE-2008-2300.body: An unspecified error related to access controls in Citrix Presentation Server could allow a remote authenticated attacker to gain unauthorized access to published applications and desktops using unknown attack vectors.Refer to CTX116941 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2301.title: Kostenloses Linkmanagementscript view.php and topview.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2301.body: Kostenloses Linkmanagementscript is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the view.php or top_view.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2302.title: Django login form cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2302.body: Django is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input through the login form. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Django (0.91.2, 0.95.3, or 0.96.2 or later), available from the Django Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2303.title: Apple iPod touch and Apple iPhone JavaScript array code execution
CVE-2008-2303.body: Apple iPod touch and Apple iPhone could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a signedness error in the Safari browser when handling JavaScript array indices. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause an out-of-bounds memory access and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple iPod touch (2.0 or later) or Apple iPhone (2.0 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2304.title: Apple Xcode Fun House XML parsing buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2304.body: Apple Xcode is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the Core Image Fun House application. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .funhouse file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Xcode tools (3.1 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2308.title: Apple Mac OS X Alias Manager code execution
CVE-2008-2308.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an unspecified error in Alias Manager. By resolving an alias containing specially-crafted AFP volume mount information, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the system to crash.Apply Apple Security Update 2008-004 or upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.5.4 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2309.title: Apple Mac OS X CoreTypes code execution
CVE-2008-2309.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute code on the system, caused by the failure to warn users about opening unsafe file types by the CoreTypes component. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted file type that appears safe for opening, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute malicious code on the system.Apply Apple Security Update 2008-004 or upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.5.4 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2313.title: Apple Mac OS X User Template code execution
CVE-2008-2313.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by the storing of malicious files with insecure permissions on the User Template directory that remain part of the home directory. By creating a new user using the User Template directory, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the new user.Apply Apple Security Update 2008-004 or upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.5.4 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2315.title: Python multiple files integer overflow
CVE-2008-2315.body: Python is vulnerable to multiple integer overflows in the pymem.h, _csv.c, _struct.c, arraymodule.c, audioop.c, binascii.c, cPickle.c, cStringIO.c, multibytecodec.c, datetimemodule.c, md5.c, rgbimgmodule.c, stropmodule.c, bufferobject.c, listobject.c, obmalloc.c, node.c, asdl.c, ast.c, bltinmodule.c, and compile.c files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified attack vector to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Refer to GLSA 200807-16 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2315.title: Python multiple modules integer overflow
CVE-2008-2315.body: Python is vulnerable to multiple integer overflows in the stringobject, unicodeobject, bufferobject, longobject, tupleobject, stropmodule, gcmodule, and mmapmodule modules. By sending specially-crafted data to one of the affected modules using an unspecified attack vector, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Refer to the Python SVN Repository for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2316.title: Python hashlib module integer overflow
CVE-2008-2316.body: The Python hashlib module is vulnerable to an integer overflow, which could result in weaker than expected security related to the cryptographic digest.Refer to the Python SVN Repository for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2316.title: Python multiple files integer overflow
CVE-2008-2316.body: Python is vulnerable to multiple integer overflows in the pymem.h, _csv.c, _struct.c, arraymodule.c, audioop.c, binascii.c, cPickle.c, cStringIO.c, multibytecodec.c, datetimemodule.c, md5.c, rgbimgmodule.c, stropmodule.c, bufferobject.c, listobject.c, obmalloc.c, node.c, asdl.c, ast.c, bltinmodule.c, and compile.c files. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified attack vector to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Refer to GLSA 200807-16 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2317.title: Apple iPod touch and Apple iPhone style sheets code execution
CVE-2008-2317.body: Apple iPod touch and Apple iPhone could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption error in the WebCore component of Safari when handling style sheet elements. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the Safari browser to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple iPod touch (2.0 or later) or Apple iPhone (2.0 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2320.title: Apple Mac OS X CarbonCore buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2320.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by CarbonCore. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an overly long filename to overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Security Update 2008-005, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2321.title: Apple Mac OS X CoreGraphics code execution
CVE-2008-2321.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption error in CoreGraphics. By persuading a victim to visit a Web site that passes specially-crafted arguments to CoreGraphics, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Apply Security Update 2008-005, available from the Apple Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2322.title: Apple Mac OS X CoreGraphics PDF buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2322.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by an integer overflow in CoreGraphics. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted PDF file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Apply Security Update 2008-005, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2323.title: Apple Mac OS X Data Detectors Engine denial of service
CVE-2008-2323.body: Apple Mac OS X is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the Data Detectors Engine when handling textual content. By persuading a victim to view a specially-crafted data detector message using an affected application, a remote attacker could cause the application to crash.Apply Security Update 2008-005, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2324.title: Apple Mac OS X Disk Utility privilege escalation
CVE-2008-2324.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by an error in the Disk Utility component. The Repair Permissions tool sets setuid permissions on /usr/bin/emacs. By running the Repair Permissions tool, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability using emacs to execute arbitrary commands with system privileges.Apply Security Update 2008-005, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2325.title: Apple Mac OS X QuickLook code execution
CVE-2008-2325.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption error in QuickLook. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Microsoft Office file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code or cause the application to crash.Apply Security Update 2008-005, available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2326.title: Apple Bonjour for Windows mDNSResponder denial of service
CVE-2008-2326.body: Apple Bonjour for Windows is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference in the Bonjour Namespace Provider. By persuading a victim to resolve a specially-crafted .local domain name containing an overly-long DNS label, a remote attacker could cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Apple Bonjour for Windows (1.0.5 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2329.title: Apple Mac OS X Directory Services information disclosure
CVE-2008-2329.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the Login Window of Directory Services. By injecting wildcard characters into the username field, an attacker could view the list of user names from the Active Directory and obtain sensitive information.Apply Apple Security Update 2008-004 or upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.5.5 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2330.title: Apple Mac OS X slapconfig tool information disclosure
CVE-2008-2330.body: Apple Mac OS X could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the creation of insecure temporary files by the slapconfig tool in Directory Services. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to save a current password to an attacker-controlled file and obtain sensitive information.Apply Apple Security Update 2008-004 or upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.5.5 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2331.title: Apple Mac OS X Finder weak security
CVE-2008-2331.body: Apple Mac OS X could provide weaker than expected security, caused by the failure to update displayed permissions in the Get Info window by the Finder component. By clicking the lock button, the Sharing and Permissions changes become effective without displaying the actual privileges of the file. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to launch further attacks on the vulnerable system.Apply Apple Security Update 2008-004 or upgrade to the latest version of Mac OS X (10.5.5 or later), available from the Apple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2333.title: Barracuda Spam Firewall email parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2333.body: Barracuda Spam Firewall is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the ldap_test.cgi script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the email parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Barracuda Spam Firewall Tech Alert, 2008-05-22 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2334.title: Philboard multiple SQL injection
CVE-2008-2334.body: Philboard is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the philboard_admin-forumedit.asp, philboard_admin-forum.asp, W1L3D4_konuoku.asp, W1L3D4_konuya_mesaj_yaz.asp, or the W1L3D4_foruma_yeni_konu_ac.asp script using the forumid, id, or topic parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2335.title: phpVID query parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2335.body: phpVID is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search_results.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the query parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2337.title: IMGallery multiple SQL injection
CVE-2008-2337.body: IMGallery is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the galeria.php, koment.php, and opis.php scripts using the kategoria or id_phot parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2339.title: SunShop Shopping Cart id parameter SQL injection
CVE-2008-2339.body: SunShop is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2340.title: News Manager multiple SQL injection
CVE-2008-2340.body: News Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the list_tagitems.php, advsearch.php, archive.php, or index.php scripts using the pid or lang parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2342.title: News Manager attachments.php directory traversal
CVE-2008-2342.body: News Manager could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the attachments.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the id parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2343.title: News Manager multiple .php scripts information disclosure
CVE-2008-2343.body: News Manager could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the connect_str.php and info.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this via a direct request to obtain sensitive information.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2344.title: air_filemanager extension for TYPO3 unspecified cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2344.body: The air_filemanager extension for TYPO3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of air_filemanager (0.6.2 or later), available from the TYPO3 Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2345.title: air_filemanager extension for TYPO3 unspecified code execution
CVE-2008-2345.body: An unspecified vulnerability in the air_filemanager extension for TYPO3 could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors to execute arbitrary PHP code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of air_filemanager (0.6.2 or later), available from the TYPO3 Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2346.title: AlkalinePHP adduser.php security bypass
CVE-2008-2346.body: AlkalinePHP could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper checking by the admin page. By sending a specially-crafted request to the adduser.php script, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and create a new admin account.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2347.title: Mypicgallery addUser.php security bypass
CVE-2008-2347.body: Mypicgallery could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by the improper checking of authentication credentials by the addUser.php script. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass security restrictions and create a new admin account.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2348.title: MeltingIce File System adduser.php security bypass
CVE-2008-2348.body: MeltingIce File System could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the adduser.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted HTTP POST request to add arbitrary user accounts and possibly launch further attacks against the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2349.title: Zomplog newuser.php security bypass
CVE-2008-2349.body: Zomplog could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the newuser.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an HTTP POST request to add arbitrary user accounts and possibly launch further attacks against the affected application.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2350.title: bcoos highlight.php directory traversal
CVE-2008-2350.body: bcoos could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker with administrative access could send a specially-crafted URL request to the highlight.php script containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) in the file parameter to view arbitrary files on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2351.title: CMS WebManager-Pro index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2351.body: CMS WebManager-Pro is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the lang_id or menu_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2352.title: Smeego index.php file include
CVE-2008-2352.body: Smeego could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If magic_quotes_gpc is disabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing an appended NULL byte (%00) to the index.php script using the lang cookie parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2353.title: GNU/Gallery admin.php file include
CVE-2008-2353.body: GNU/Gallery could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the admin.php script using the show parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2355.title: WR-Meeting index.php file include
CVE-2008-2355.body: WR-Meeting could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing an appended NULL byte (%00) to the index.php script using the msnum parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2356.title: Archangel Weblog index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2356.body: Archangel Weblog is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the post_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2357.title: mtr split_redraw() buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2357.body: mtr is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the split_redraw function when the -p or --split option is enabled. By persuading a victim to connect to a DNS server containing a specially-crafted host name, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Mtr (0.73 or later), available from the Mtr Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2358.title: Linux Kernel dccp_feat_change() buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2358.body: Linux Kernel is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the dccp_feat_change() function within the Datagram Congestion Control Protocol (DCCP) subsystem. By sending a specially-crafted request, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with kernel privileges or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (2.6.25.5 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2363.title: Pan .nzb file buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2363.body: Pan is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking when parsing malicious files. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted .nzb file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to the Pan Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2364.title: Apache HTTP Server mod_proxy module denial of service
CVE-2008-2364.body: Apache HTTP Server is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the mod_proxy module ap_proxy_http_process_response function. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability via forwarded "Expect: 100-continue" requests from the server to the client to cause the consumption of memory resources. Note: This vulnerability affects multiple vendor HTTP server components that utilize the Apache mod_status module. See References.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the Apache-SVN Repository. See References.For WebSphere Application Server 6.0.2:Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.31 or later) or APAR PK67579. See References.For WebSphere Application Server 6.1.0:Apply the latest Fix Pack (6.0.2.19 or later) or APAR PK67579. See References.ORAs a workaround, ensure the directive starting with the following text is commented out in the HIS configuration: LoadModule proxy_moduleFor other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2367.title: Red Hat Certificate Server configuration file information disclosure
CVE-2008-2367.body: Red Hat Certificate Server could allow local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by insecure default file permissions on certain configuration files including password.conf. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain authentication credentials and other sensitive information.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2369.title: Red Hat Network Satellite Server manzier.pxt information disclosure
CVE-2008-2369.body: Red Hat Network Satellite Server could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The XML-RPC manzier.pxt script contains a single hard-coded authentication key. An attacker connected to the Satellite Server XML-RPC service could exploit this vulnerability to obtain login names, associated email addresses, internal user IDs, and partial information about entitlements.Refer to RHSA-2008-0630 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2372.title: Linux kernel get_user_pages function denial of service
CVE-2008-2372.body: The Linux kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the get_user_pages function. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a large number of calls to allocate newly zeroed pages resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of the Linux kernel (2.6.25.9 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2377.title: GnuTLS gnutls_handshake.c code execution
CVE-2008-2377.body: GnuTLS could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a use after free vulnerability in the _gnutls_handshake_hash_buffers_clear function in gnutls_handshake.c. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via TLS data transmissions to execute arbitrary code or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of GnuTLS (2.4.1 or later), available from the GNU Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2378.title: hf hfkernel privilege escalation
CVE-2008-2378.body: hf could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by the insecure execution of "killall" by the hfkernel application. By sending a specially-crafted "-k" command line argument, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges on the system.Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2379.title: SquirrelMail HTML cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2379.body: SquirrelMail is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the HTML parts of an email message to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the message is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of SquirrelMail (1.4.17 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2380.title: Courier Authentication Library Postgres SQL injection
CVE-2008-2380.body: Courier Authentication Library is vulnerable to SQL injection. If a Postgres database is used for authentication and a Non-Latin character set is selected, a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the library, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Courier Authentication Library (0.62.0 or later), available from the Courier Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2381.title: GForge create() SQL injection
CVE-2008-2381.body: GForge is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the create() function in GroupJoinRequest.class.php using the comments variable, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the fix for this vulnerability, available from the GForge SCM Repository. See References.

CVE-2008-2382.title: QEMU and KVM protocol_client_msg() denial of service
CVE-2008-2382.body: QEMU and KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an infinite loop within the protocol_client_msg() function. By sending a specially-crafted message to the host, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the server to enter into an infinite loop resulting in a denial of service.For KVM:Upgrade to the latest version of KVM (81 or later), available from the KVM Download Web page. See References.For QEMU:Refer to the QEMU SVN repository for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2383.title: xterm DECRQSS Device Control Request Status String code execution
CVE-2008-2383.body: xterm could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in DECRQSS Device Control Request Status String escape sequence processing. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted text file containing certain escape sequences, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.For Apple Mac OS:Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2384.title: libapache2-mod-auth-mysql module for Debian multibyte encoding SQL injection
CVE-2008-2384.body: The libapache2-mod-auth-mysql module for Debian is vulnerable to SQL injection in the escape sequences. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements using multibyte character encoding, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2390.title: HP Software Update ActiveX control (Hpufunction.dll) code execution
CVE-2008-2390.body: The HP Software Update ActiveX control (Hpufunction.dll) could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site that passes specially-crafted arguments to the ExecuteAsync or Execute method, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2391.title: SubSonic pagesize limit denial of service
CVE-2008-2391.body: SubSonic is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in pagesize limits. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a negative value pageindex parameter to cause the utilization of all CPU resources.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2392.title: WordPress Write Tabs file upload
CVE-2008-2392.body: WordPress could allow a remote authenticated attacker with administrative privileges to upload arbitrary files, caused by improper validation of file extensions. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the upload section in the Write Tabs area to upload a malicious file, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2393.title: EntertainmentScript play.php SQL injection

CVE-2008-2400.title: Stunnel Windows privilege escalation
CVE-2008-2400.body: An unspecified error in Michael Trojnara's Stunnel, when running as a Windows service, could allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary commands with LocalSystem privileges on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Stunnel (4.23 or later), available from the Stunnel Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2401.title: Sun Java System Active Server Pages file creation code execution
CVE-2008-2401.body: Sun Java System Active Server Pages could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a file creation error within files included in multiple ASP applications. By connecting to the administration server on TCP port 5100, a remote attacker could create or modify arbitrary files to execute arbitrary code on the system with root privileges.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238184 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2402.title: Sun Java System Active Server Pages password information disclosure
CVE-2008-2402.body: Sun Java System Active Server Pages could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information. The password and configuration data are stored in the root directory of the application server. By sending a specially-crafted request to TCP port 5100, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the configuration or password hash of a valid user.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238184 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2403.title: Sun Java System Active Server Pages directory traversal
CVE-2008-2403.body: Sun Java System Active Server Pages could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. An attacker could send a specially-crafted HTTP request via the administration server to an affected ASP application containing "dot dot" sequences (/../) to obtain sensitive information or delete arbitrary files on the system with root privileges.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238184 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2404.title: Sun Java System Active Server Pages ASP server buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2404.body: Sun Java System Active Server Pages is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the request handling code within the ASP server. By sending a specially-crafted request to TCP port 80, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the ASP server.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238184 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2405.title: Sun Java System Active Server Pages shell command execution
CVE-2008-2405.body: Sun Java System Active Server Pages could allow a remote authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by improper validation of user supplied input. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request containing shell metacharacters, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238184 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2406.title: Sun Java System Active Server Pages administration authentication bypass
CVE-2008-2406.body: Sun Java System Active Server Pages could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication restrictions, caused by an error in the administration application server. By making a direct request via the listening service on TCP port 5102, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass authentication restrictions.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238184 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2008-2407.body: Trillian is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by aim.dll. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of 427BB (2.3.2 or later), available from the SourceForge.net Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2562.title: Power Phlogger edCss.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2562.body: Power Phlogger is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to edCss.php using the css_str parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2563.title: SamTodo index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2563.body: SamTodo is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. If "go" is set to "main.taskeditor" or "main.default", a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the tid or completed parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

(1.0.3 or later), available from the Joomla! Extensions Directory Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2566.body: PHP Address Book is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the group parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of January 3, 2015.

CVE-2008-2566.title: PHP Address Book group parameter cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2566.body: PHP Address Book is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the index.php script. CVE-2008-2567.title: Sleipnir favorite search cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2567.body: Sleipnir is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the "favorite search" to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. CVE-2008-2568.title: Simple Shop Galore component for Joomla! index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2568.body: The Simple Shop Galore component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. If "option" is set to "com_simpleshop" and "task" is set to "browse", a remote attacker with knowledge of the database table prefix could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the catid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Simple Shop Galore component for Joomla! (3.5 or later), available from the Galore Web page. See References.

CVE-2008-2571.title: LimeSurvey modify quota action cross-site request forgery
CVE-2008-2571.body: LimeSurvey (formerly PHPSurveyor) is vulnerable to cross-site request forgery, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could send a malformed HTTP request to cause the victim to perform the "modify quota action" and other arbitrary tasks. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to perform cross-site scripting attacks, Web cache poisoning, and other malicious activities.Upgrade to the latest version of LimeSurvey (1.71 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2008-2633.body: The EXP JoomRadio component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-2635.body: BitKinex could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by an error in the WebDAV and FTP clients. By persuading a victim to download a directory containing a file with "dot dot" sequences using forward-slash or backslash characters (../ or ..\) in the filename via the LIST or PROPFIND command, an attacker could traverse directories and write arbitrary files to the system.Upgrade to the latest version of BitKinex (3.0 or later), available from the BitKinex Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2636.title: Cisco Linksys WRH54G router HTTP denial of service
CVE-2008-2636.body: The Cisco Linksys WRH54G router is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of requests. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request containing an overly long string and other characters, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to crash the http service.Upgrade to the latest firmware version of the Cisco Linksys WRH54G router firmware (1.01.04 or later), available from the Linksys Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2637.title: F5 FirePass webyfiers.php and index.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2637.body: F5 FirePass is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the webyfiers.php and index.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the css_exceptions or the sql_matchscope parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2638.title: 1Book guestbook.php code execution
CVE-2008-2638.body: 1Book could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the guestbook.php script before being written in the data.php file. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the message parameter to inject and execute arbitrary PHP code on the system.Upgrade to the latest version of 1Book (1.0.2 or later), available from the 1Scripts Web site. CVE-2008-2639.title: CitectSCADA and CitectFacilities ODBC service buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2639.body: CitectSCADA and CitectFacilities are vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the ODBC service. By sending an overly long packet to TCP port 20222, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.CitectSCADA and CitectFacilities customers should contact Citect support for upgrade or patch information. See References.

CVE-2008-2640.title: Adobe Flex History Management cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2640.body: Adobe Flex is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the historyFrame.html script within the History Management feature. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unknown parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to APSB08-14 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2642.title: OtomiGenX index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2642.body: OtomiGenX is vulnerable to SQL injection. If "menu" is set to "login" and "act" is set to "verify", a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the userAccount parameter, which could allow the attacker to bypass the login mechanism and view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2642.title: OtomiGenX login.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2642.body: OtomiGenX is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the login.php script, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2645.title: Brim (formerly Booby) renderer parameter file include
CVE-2008-2645.body: Brim (formerly known as Booby) could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the template.tpl.php script using the renderer parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote or the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code using a local file, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2647.title: meBiblio journal_change_mask.inc.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2647.body: meBiblio is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-2648.title: meBiblio uploader.html file upload
CVE-2008-2648.body: meBiblio could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by the improper validation of file extensions by the uploader.html script. By sending a specially-crafted HTTP request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to upload arbitrary files, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2650.title: CMSimple index.php file upload
CVE-2008-2650.body: CMSimple could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by the improper restricting of access to valid users by the index.php script. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to upload arbitrary files and execute arbitrary PHP code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of CMSimple (3.1 downloaded after 06-01-2008), available from the CMSimple Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2650.title: CMSimple index.php file include
CVE-2008-2650.body: CMSimple could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing an appended NULL byte (%00) to the index.php script using the sl parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of CMSimple (3.1 downloaded after 06-01-2008), available from the CMSimple Web site. CVE-2008-2654.title: Motion read_client function buffer overflow

An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors to trigger memory corruption and execute arbitrary code or cause the affected application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (1.8.5-p231, 1.8.6-p230, 1.8.7-p22, or 1.9.0-2), available from the Ruby Programming Language Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2663.title: Ruby rb_ary_store function code execution

CVE-2008-2664.title: Ruby rb_str_format function code execution
CVE-2008-2664.body: Ruby could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a memory corruption error in the rb_str_format function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors related to alloca to corrupt memory and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the affected application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (1.8.5-p231, 1.8.6-p230, 1.8.7-p22, or 1.9.0-2), available from the Ruby Programming Language Web site. CVE-2008-2665.title: PHP posix_access() security bypass
CVE-2008-2665.body: PHP could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in the posix_access() and possibly other functions. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted PHP script to bypass safe mode restrictions on a shared-server environment to access arbitrary files outside of the Web root and possibly launch further attacks against the system.For Apple Mac OS:Apply Apple Security Update 2009-002, available from the Apple Web site. See References.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (5.2.7 or later), available from the PHP Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

See References.Upgrade to the latest version of PHP (5.2.7 or later), available from the PHP Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the clients.php, kb.php, login.php, index.php, contact_view.php, contact.php, or clients.php script using the bcrm_pub_root parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2691.title: JiRo's FAQ Manager read.asp SQL injection
CVE-2008-2691.body: JiRo's FAQ Manager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the read.asp script using the fID parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2692.title: yvComment component for Joomla! index.php script SQL injection
CVE-2008-2692.body: yvComment component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. If "option" is set to "com_yvcomment", a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the ArticleID parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of yvComment (1.16.1 or later), available from the Yuri Volkov Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2694.title: phpInv search.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2694.body: phpInv is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the search.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the keyword parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2695.title: phpInv entry.php file include
CVE-2008-2695.body: phpInv could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing an appended NULL byte (%00) to the entry.php script using the action parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2696.title: Exiv2 printing denial of service
CVE-2008-2696.body: Exiv2 is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a floating point exception in the printing function while processing Nicon camera lens information. By sending a specially-crafted metadata image using the Exiv2 library, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of Exiv2 (0.17 or later), available from the Exiv2 Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2697.title: Rapid Recipe component for Joomla! recipe_id SQL injection
CVE-2008-2697.body: Rapid Recipe component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. If "option" is set to "com_rapidrecipe" and "page" to "viewrecipe", a remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the recipe_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Rapid Recipe (1.6.8 or later), available from the Rapid-Source Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2698.title: WEBalbum photo_add-c.php cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2698.body: WEBalbum is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the photo_add-c.php script. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using the comment or id parameter to inject malicious script into a Web page which would be executed in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the page is viewed. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2699.title: Galatolo WebManager index.php file include
CVE-2008-2699.body: Galatolo WebManager could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request containing an appended NULL byte (%00) to the index.php script using the com parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2700.title: Galatolo WebManager view.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2700.body: Galatolo WebManager is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the view.php script using the id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2701.title: GameQ component for Joomla! index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2701.body: GameQ component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker with knowledge of the database table prefix could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the category_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2702.title: ALFTP FTP Client LIST directory traversal
CVE-2008-2702.body: ALFTP FTP Client could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system. By persuading a victim to connect and download a directory containing a file with "dot dot" sequences using forward-slash or backslash characters (../ or ..\) in the filename using the LIST command, a remote attacker could traverse directories and write arbitrary files to the system.Upgrade to the latest version of ALFTP (5.1 beta 1 or later), available from the ALFTP Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2703.title: Novell GroupWise Messenger Messenger Client buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2703.body: Novell GroupWise Messenger is vulnerable to multiple stack-based buffer overflows, caused by improper bounds checking by the Novell GroupWise Messenger Client. By sending a spoofed server response to valid client requests, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to Novell Technical Information Document ID: 5026700 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2704.title: Novell GroupWise Messenger Messenger Client denial of service
CVE-2008-2704.body: Novell GroupWise Messenger is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the Messenger Client when handling user IDs. By submitting an overly long user ID, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the client to crash.Refer to Novell Technical Information Document ID: 5026700 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2705.title: Sun Java System Access Manager unspecified security bypass
CVE-2008-2705.body: An unspecified vulnerability in Sun Java System Access Manager could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions and gain unauthorized access to system resources. Under certain configurations, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain administrative privileges without authentication for the vulnerable system.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238416 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2706.title: Sun Solaris event port denial of service
CVE-2008-2706.body: Sun Solaris is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the event port implementation. By executing a specially-crafted application that enters and receives user-defined port events, a local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a system panic resulting in a denial of service.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 235122 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2707.title: Sun Solaris e1000g Gigabit Ethernet driver denial of service
CVE-2008-2707.body: Sun Solaris is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error in the e1000g Gigabit Ethernet driver on systems with Intel 82571/82572 network interface controllers. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to block all incoming network packets and cause a denial of service.Refer to Sun Alert ID: 238250 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2709.title: IBM OS/400 BrSmRcvAndCheck buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2709.body: IBM OS/400 is vulnerable to a buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking within BrSmRcvAndCheck. By running diagnostics on a modem port, a local attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Refer to IBM Support & downloads Web site for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2711.title: Fetchmail verbose log message denial of service
CVE-2008-2711.body: Fetchmail is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a pointer dereference error when parsing large log messages in verbose mode. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted email containing overly long headers to crash the application.Refer to Novell Bugzilla Bug 354291 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2713.title: Clam AntiVirus libclamav/petite.c denial of service
CVE-2008-2713.body: Clam AntiVirus is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an invalid memory access error in libclamav/petite.c. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted Petite compressed executable to cause a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Clam AntiVirus (0.93.1 or later), available from the ClamAV Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2715.title: Opera HTML CANVAS information disclosure
CVE-2008-2715.body: Opera could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error during HTML CANVAS element image source checking. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted script to obtain cross-domain image data.Upgrade to the latest version of Opera (9.5 or later), available from the Opera Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2717.title: TYPO3 filename file upload
CVE-2008-2717.body: TYPO3 could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by the improper validation of file extensions using a default fileDenyPattern for Apache if the mod_mime Apache module is enabled. By sending a specially-crafted filename with multiple file extensions or prepended by a dot character, a remote attacker with valid backend user credentials and access to an arbitrary filemount could exploit this vulnerability to upload malicious PHP files, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary PHP code on the vulnerable system.Refer to TYPO3-20080611-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2718.title: TYPO3 fe_adminlib.inc cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2718.body: TYPO3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by fe_adminlib.inc script. If a frontend extension based on fe_adminlib.inc is installed, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unspecified parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to TYPO3-20080611-1 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2719.title: NASM ppscan() buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2719.body: NASM is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by off-by-one error within the ppscan() function. By persuading a victim to assemble a specially crafted ASM file, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer with a zero byte and execute arbitrary code on the system or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of NASM (2.03 or later), available from the NASM Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2720.title: Gallery unspecified scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2720.body: Gallery is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by unspecified scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unknown parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Gallery (2.2.5 or later), available from the Gallery Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2724.title: Gallery Password module security bypass
CVE-2008-2724.body: Gallery could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper restrictions in the Password module. If an item is password protected, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass permission restrictions and gain unauthorized access to non-album items.Upgrade to the latest version of Gallery (2.2.5 or later), available from the Gallery Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2725.title: Ruby rb_ary_splice function code execution
CVE-2008-2725.body: Ruby could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow error in the rb_ary_splice function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors related to REALLOC_N to corrupt memory and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the affected application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (1.8.5-p231, 1.8.6-p230, 1.8.7-p22, or 1.9.0-2), available from the Ruby Programming Language Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2726.title: Ruby rb_ary_splice function beg + rlen code execution
CVE-2008-2726.body: Ruby could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow error in the rb_ary_splice function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using unknown attack vectors related to beg + rlen to corrupt memory and possibly execute arbitrary code or cause the affected application to crash.Apply the patch for this vulnerability (1.8.5-p231, 1.8.6-p230, 1.8.7-p22, or 1.9.0-2), available from the Ruby Programming Language Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2729.title: Linux kernel arch/x86_64/lib/copy_user.s destination memory information disclosure
CVE-2008-2729.body: The Linux kernel could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the failure to erase destination memory locations after an exception by the arch/x86_64/lib/copy_user.s file. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain sensitive kernel information from the system.Upgrade to the latest version of the Linux kernel (2.6.25.10 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-2730.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (RIS) Data Collector service information disclosure
CVE-2008-2730.body: Cisco Unified Communications Manager (CUCM) could allow a remote attacker to bypass authentication and obtain information, caused by an error in the Real-Time Information Server (RIS) Data Collector service. By connecting directly to the RIS Data Collector service using TCP port 2556, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain read-only access to restricted information and obtain the performance statistics and user names of the CUCM cluster.Refer to cisco-sa-20080625-cucm for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2734.title: Cisco ASA SSL VPN denial of service
CVE-2008-2734.body: Cisco ASA devices are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a memory leak error when configured to terminate clientless VPN connections. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted SSL packet to cause the device to reload.Refer to cisco-sa-20080903-asa for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2735.title: Cisco ASA URI denial of service
CVE-2008-2735.body: Cisco ASA devices are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a URI processing error when configured to terminate clientless VPN connections. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted HTTP packet to cause the device to reload.Refer to cisco-sa-20080903-asa for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2736.title: Cisco ASA clientless VPN information disclosure
CVE-2008-2736.body: Cisco ASA devices could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error when configured to terminate clientless VPN connections. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web site, reply to an email, or interact with a service, an attacker could obtain usernames and passwords.Refer to cisco-sa-20080903-asa for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-2742.title: Achievo config.php file upload
CVE-2008-2742.body: Achievo could allow a remote attacker to upload arbitrary files, caused by the improper validation of file extensions by the config.php script in the FCKEditor component if the mod_mime module is installed. By sending a specially-crafted request, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to upload malicious PHP files, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary PHP code on the vulnerable system.Upgrade to the latest version of Achievo (1.3.3 or later), available from the Achievo Web site. CVE-2008-2743.title: Multiple Xerox Copier/Printer products Web server cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-2743.body: Multiple Xerox Copier/Printer products are vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the Web server. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an unknown parameter in a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Refer to Xerox Security Bulletin XRX08-007 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2008-2745.title: Annotation SDK ActiveX control (BiAnno.ocx) AnnoSaveToTiff method buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2745.body: The Annotation SDK ActiveX control (BiAnno.ocx) is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the AnnoSaveToTiff method. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page that passes an overly long argument to the AnnoSaveToTiff method, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2746.title: gllcTS2 login.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2746.body: gllcTS2 is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-2747.body: No-IP DUC (Dynamic DNS Update Client) could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information. The HKLM\SOFTWARE\Vitalwerks\DUC registry key stores obfuscated values insecurely. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to obtain the TrayPassword, Username, Password, and Hosts registry values.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Apply the patch for this vulnerability, available from the GlassFish Web site. See References.

A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the sbjoke_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2875.title: Webdevindo-CMS index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-2875.body: Webdevindo-CMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the hal parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2876.title: mUnky index.php file include
CVE-2008-2876.body: mUnky could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the zone parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2877.title: cmsWorks lib.module.php file include
CVE-2008-2877.body: cmsWorks could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the lib.module.php script using the mod_root parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2880.title: IBM AFP Viewer Plug-in buffer overflow
CVE-2008-2880.body: The IBM AFP Viewer Plug-in is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site that passes an overly long string to the SRC property, a remote attacker could overflow a buffer and execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges or cause the application to crash.Upgrade to the latest version of AFP Viewer Plug-in (3.4.1.7 or later), available from the IBM Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2882.title: sHibby sHop urun.mdb information disclosure
CVE-2008-2882.body: sHibby sHop could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by improper restrictions on the urun.mdb file inside the Web root. By sending a direct request, a remote attacker could download the database file and obtain sensitive information, which could be used to launch further attacks against the affected system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2884.title: RSS-aggregator display.php file include
CVE-2008-2884.body: RSS-aggregator could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals, allow_url_fopen and allow_url_include are enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the display.php script using the path parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2885.title: ODARS CLASSES_ROOT parameter file include
CVE-2008-2885.body: ODARS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the resource_categories_view.php script using the CLASSES_ROOT parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2886.title: Jamroom purchase.php file include
CVE-2008-2886.body: Jamroom could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. If register_globals is enabled, a remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the purchase.php script using the jamroom[jm_dir] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.Upgrade to the latest version of Jamroom (3.3.6 or later), available from the Jamroom Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-2887.body: FubarForum could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the index.php script using the page parameter to specify a malicious file from the local system, which could allow the attacker to obtain sensitive information or execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.Upgrade to the latest version of FubarForum (1.6 or later), available from the FubarForum Web page. See References.

CVE-2008-2888.title: MiGCMS GLOBALS[application][app_root] parameter file include
CVE-2008-2888.body: MiGCMS could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. A remote attacker could send a specially-crafted URL request to the collection.class.php or the content_image.class.php script using the GLOBALS[application][app_root] parameter to specify a malicious file from a remote system, which could allow the attacker to execute arbitrary code on the vulnerable Web server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2890.body: Online Fantasy Football League is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the leagues.php, players.php or teams.php scripts using the league_id, player_id or fflteam_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2891.body: emuCMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-2892.body: The EXP Shop component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. If "option" is set to "com_expshop" and "page" to "show_payment", a remote attacker with knowledge of the database table prefix could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the catid parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2894.title: Classic FTP LIST directory traversal
CVE-2008-2894.body: Classic FTP could allow a remote attacker to traverse directories on the system, caused by an error in the FTP client. By persuading a victim to download a directory containing a file with "dot dot" sequences using forward-slash or backslash characters (../ or ..\) in the filename via the LIST command, an attacker could traverse directories and write arbitrary files to the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2895.body: Aprox CMS Engine could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. See References.

CVE-2008-2896.title: FireAnt index.php file include
CVE-2008-2896.body: FireAnt could allow a remote attacker to include arbitrary files. Note: In order to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code, the attacker would first be required to upload a malicious file or inject arbitrary commands into an existing file.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2900.body: phpAuction is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-2906.body: WebChamado is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the lista_anexos.php script using the tsk_id parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-2907.body: WebChamado is vulnerable to SQL injection.
