CVE-2008-3246.body: An unsupported SNMP version has been detected. Versions greater than 3 are not supported and are not parsed.This audit is for informational purposes only.

CVE-2008-3246.title: BlackBerry Enterprise Server Attachment Service PDF distiller code execution
CVE-2008-3246.body: BlackBerry Enterprise Server could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an error in the Attachment Service PDF distiller component. By sending an email message containing a specially-crafted PDF file attachment, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system running the BlackBerry Attachment Service, once the malicious PDF file is opened for viewing on a BlackBerry smartphone. Note: This vulnerability also affects the attachment service used in BlackBerry Unite!.Refer to BlackBerry Security Advisory KB15766 or BlackBerry Security Advisory KB15770 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. CVE-2008-3247.body: Linux Kernel is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of an LDT buffer size on an x86_64 system. A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the system to crash or possibly execute arbitrary code on the system with elevated privileges.Upgrade to the latest version of Linux Kernel (2.6.25.11 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-3250.body: Arctic is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the filter parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of Arctic (2.0.1 or later), available from the Arctic Tracker Web site. CVE-2008-3251.title: tplSoccerSite id or opp SQL injection
CVE-2008-3251.body: tplSoccerSite is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php, player.php, opponent.php, matchdetails.php and the additionalpage.php scripts using the id or opp parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.Upgrade to the latest version of TPL Design (1.01 or later), available from the TPL Design Web site. CVE-2008-3252.body: newsx is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper bounds checking by the read_article() function. CVE-2008-3253.body: Citrix XenServer is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the XenAPI HTTP interfaces. CVE-2008-3254.title: preCMS index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-3254.body: preCMS is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-3255.body: LunarNight Laboratory WebProxy is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input. CVE-2008-3256.title: Siteframe folder.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-3256.body: Siteframe is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-3258.body: Zoph is vulnerable to SQL injection. CVE-2008-3259.title: OpenSSH X11 forwarding information disclosure
CVE-2008-3259.body: OpenSSH could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error when binding to previously bound ports that have the SO_REUSEADDR option enabled and the sshd_config X11UseLocalhost option set to no. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability via man-in-the-middle techniques to obtain sensitive information on systems where effective user-id or overlapping bind address checks are not present.Upgrade to the latest version of OpenSSH (5.1 or later), available from the OpenSSH Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-3260.title: Claroline multiple scripts cross-site scripting
CVE-2008-3260.body: Claroline is vulnerable to cross-site scripting, caused by improper validation of user-supplied input by the rqmkhtml.php, announcements.php, agenda.php, index.php, document.php, exercise.php, group_space.php, newtopic.php, reply.php, viewtopic.php, wiki.php, and work.php scripts. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a specially-crafted URL to execute script in a victim's Web browser within the security context of the hosting Web site, once the URL is clicked. An attacker could use this vulnerability to steal the victim's cookie-based authentication credentials.Upgrade to the latest version of Claroline (1.8.10 or later), available from the SourceForge.net: Files Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-3263.title: Asterisk POKE denial of service
CVE-2008-3263.body: Asterisk is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper handling of IAX2 POKE requests. By sending a flood of IAX2 POKE requests missing an ACK packet in response to the PONG packet, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume all IAX2 call numbers resulting in a denial of service.Refer to AST-2008-010 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-3264.title: Asterisk download protocol denial of service
CVE-2008-3264.body: Asterisk is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the failure to require a handshake by the firmware download protocol. By sending a spoofed IAX2 FWDOWNL request that consumes a minimum of 40 bytes from a 1040 byte response, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to flood the server with unwanted packets resulting in a denial of service.Refer to AST-2008-011 for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.

CVE-2008-3265.title: DT Register component for Joomla! index.php SQL injection
CVE-2008-3265.body: The DT Register component for Joomla! is vulnerable to SQL injection. If "option" is set to "com_dtregister" and "task" to "pay_options", a remote attacker with knowledge of the database table prefix could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the index.php script using the eventId parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3266.title: HRS Multi picture_pic_bv.asp SQL injection
CVE-2008-3266.body: HRS Multi (Hotel Reservation System Script) is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the picture_pic_bv.asp script using the key parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3267.title: MojoJobs mojoJobs.cgi SQL injection
CVE-2008-3267.body: MojoJobs is vulnerable to SQL injection. A remote attacker could send specially-crafted SQL statements to the mojoJobs.cgi script using the cat_a parameter, which could allow the attacker to view, add, modify or delete information in the back-end database.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3268.title: phpScheduleIt unspecified security bypass
CVE-2008-3268.body: phpScheduleIt could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by improper restrictions placed on an unspecified script. If useLogonName is enabled, a remote attacker with knowledge of the email address for the admin could exploit this vulnerability to gain unauthorized administrative access to the application.Upgrade to the latest version of phpScheduleIt (1.2.10 or later), available from SourceForge.net: Files. See References.

CVE-2008-3269.title: WinRemotePC packets denial of service
CVE-2008-3269.body: WinRemotePC is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by the improper validation of invalid packets. By sending overly long or malformed packets to TCP port 4321, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume all available CPU and memory resources, resulting in a denial of service.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3271.title: Apache Tomcat RemoteFilterValve security bypass
CVE-2008-3271.body: Apache Tomcat could allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an error in valves that extend the RemoteFilterValve, including the RemoteAddrValve and RemoteHostValve implementations. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability using a request that is processed concurrently with another request but in a different thread to allow a user from a non-permitted IP address to gain access to protected context.Upgrade to the latest version of Apache Tomcat (4.1.32, 5.5.1, or later), available from the Apache Tomcat Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-3272.title: Linux Kernel seq_oss_synth.c information disclosure
CVE-2008-3272.body: The Linux Kernel could allow a local attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by an error in the seq_oss_synth.c snd_seq_oss_synth_make_info function. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability using an invalid device number to obtain sensitive information.Upgrade to the latest version of the Linux Kernel (2.6.27-rc2 or later), available from The Linux Kernel Archives Web site. See References.

CVE-2008-3282.title: OpenOffice rtl_allocateMemory() function code execution
CVE-2008-3282.body: OpenOffice could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a numeric truncation error in the rtl_allocateMemory() function. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted OpenOffice document, an attacker could execute arbitrary code or cause the application to crash.Apply the appropriate patch for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-3283.title: Red Hat Directory Server memory leaks denial of service
CVE-2008-3283.body: Red Hat Directory Server is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by multiple memory leaks. By sending specially-crafted requests, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to consume all available CPU resources resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of Red Hat Directory Server (7.1 SP7 or later), available from the Red Hat Web site. See References.For other distributions:Apply the appropriate update for your system. See References.

CVE-2008-3285.title: Filesys::SmbClientParser directory command execution
CVE-2008-3285.body: The Filesys::SmbClientParser Perl module could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the system, caused by the improper escaping of special characters in folder names of shared directories. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted directory shared by an SMB server containing malicious shell characters, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject and execute arbitrary shell commands on the system.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3286.title: SWAT 4 GAMESPYRESPONSE denial of service
CVE-2008-3286.body: SWAT 4 is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by an error when handling a malformed RS string. By sending the specially-crafted GAMESPYRESPONSE command containing an overly long RS string, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a runtime error resulting in a denial of service.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3286.title: SWAT 4 VERIFYCONTENT or GAMECONFIG denial of service
CVE-2008-3286.body: SWAT 4 is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a NULL pointer dereference error. By sending a specially-crafted VERIFYCONTENT or GAMECONFIG command to the FString function, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to crash the game server.No remedy available as of September 1, 2014.

CVE-2008-3289.body: EMC Retrospect could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information, caused by the transmitting of the client password hash in plain text. CVE-2008-3290.body: EMC Retrospect is vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a memory corruption error in the retroclient.exe process. By sending specially-crafted packets to TCP port 497, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause the process to stop responding, resulting in a denial of service.Upgrade to the latest version of EMC Retrospect (7.6 or later), available from the EMC Web site. CVE-2008-3471.title: Microsoft Windows Knowledge Base Article 956416 update is not installed
CVE-2008-3471.body: Microsoft Knowledge Base Article 956416 is not installed, which could allow a remote attacker to exploit the following vulnerabilities: Microsoft Excel could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper validation of calendar object data in the VBA Performance Cache. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Office Excel file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim. Microsoft Excel is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow, caused by improper processing of the Microsoft Excel spreadsheet BIFF file format. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Office Excel file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim. Microsoft Excel could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in the REPT function. By persuading a victim to open a specially-crafted Office Excel file, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS08-057. See References.

CVE-2008-3472.title: Microsoft Windows Knowledge Base Article 956390 update is not installed
CVE-2008-3472.body: Microsoft Knowledge Base Article 956390 is not installed, which could allow a remote attacker to exploit the following vulnerabilities Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by an error in the location and location.href property of a window object. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, a remote attacker could bypass same-origin policy restrictions and execute JavaScript in the context of another site. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to possibly perform cross-site scripting attacks and launch further attacks on the vulnerable system. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper handling of HTML elements. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. In Internet Explorer 6 SP1 running on Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, this vulnerability could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper handling of certain events. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. In Internet Explorer 6 SP1 running on Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, this vulnerability could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper interpretation of the identification of the origin of a script. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a vulnerability related to the componentFromPoint() JavaScript method. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of uninitialized memory. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS08-058. See References.

By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of uninitialized memory. See References.

CVE-2008-3473.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer event handling cross-domain security bypass
CVE-2008-3473.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper handling of certain events. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. In Internet Explorer 6 SP1 running on Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, this vulnerability could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References. OR Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2008-3474.title: Microsoft Internet Explorer script origin information disclosure
CVE-2008-3474.body: Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper interpretation of the identification of the origin of a script. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in the latest Microsoft Security Bulletin. See References. OR Use Microsoft Automatic Update if it is supported by your operating system. The original bulletin issued by Microsoft has been superseded.

CVE-2008-3474.body: Microsoft Knowledge Base Article 956390 is not installed, which could allow a remote attacker to exploit the following vulnerabilities Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by an error in the location and location.href property of a window object. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. In Internet Explorer 6 SP1 running on Microsoft Windows 2000 SP4, this vulnerability could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to bypass cross-domain security restrictions, caused by improper interpretation of the identification of the origin of a script. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page using Internet Explorer, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass cross-domain security restrictions and obtain sensitive information from another security zone or domain in Internet Explorer. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by a vulnerability related to the componentFromPoint() JavaScript method. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim. Microsoft Internet Explorer could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by improper handling of uninitialized memory. By persuading a victim to visit a malicious Web page, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to corrupt memory and execute arbitrary code on the system with the privileges of the victim.Apply the appropriate patch for your system, as listed in Microsoft Security Bulletin MS08-058. See References.
